location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letters No. 99-100 to Rawson Hart Boddam, President and Governor for the Public Department, Council at Bombay, from Edward Galley at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter reports the arrival of the BombayGrab .Woollen sales are discussed and it is noted that Shaikh Nasser has been ill since December. The letter also discusses orders received and other administrative matters including the debt owed (by the company) to the resident. The passing of the GreyhoundBrig en route to Bussora [Basra] is also mentioned.An account of the pay, salary, allowances, and monthly average accounts owed to Edward Galley in his role as Resident at Bushire is enclosed with the letter.The account and letter are marked No. 99 and No. 100 respectively.
